intro: Garnotia pahangensis, commonly known as the Pahang garnet, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Malaysia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, with a distinctive aromatic scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Garnotia pahangensis is considered a vulnerable species.
